item.title: Here are more Xbox Game Pass games coming this November
item.content:encoded:
Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden! Lost Records: Bloom & Rage! More!

Microsoft has just announced the next batch of games coming to Xbox Game Pass later this month and into December (ho ho ho-ly smokes, where has the year gone?!).

In the coming weeks, Game Pass subscribers can look forward to the following games making their way onto the service:

  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault (Game Preview) (PC) – 19th November via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Kulebra and the Souls of Limbo (Cloud, Console, and PC) – 19th November, now with Game Pass Premium
  • Revenge of the Savage Planet (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) – 19th November, now with Game Pass Premium
  • Monsters are Coming! Rock & Road (Handheld & PC) – 20th November, via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • The Crew Motorfest (Cloud, Console, and PC) – 20th November via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) – 25th November via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Kill It With Fire! 2 (Cloud, Console, and PC) – 25th November via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Marvel Cosmic Invasion (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC) – 1st December via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Lost Records: Bloom & Rage (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) – 2nd December via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

We called Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden a "haunting story of consequence" on its release. "Don't Nod drops the melodrama for a poignantly performed story about grief and injustice, where the difficult choices tug at your heart and principles," reads Eurogamer's four star review.

As for Lost Records: Bloom & Rage, our former editor Tom Phillips also awarded the first tape four stars. "A fascinating new narrative adventure from the original Life is Strange team, this first slice boasts fresh twists that help move the formula forward, even if its story sometimes feels a remix of genre tropes," he wrote in Eurogamer's review.

However, with new games coming to the Game Pass service, it does mean a selection of games will be leaving the library on the 30th November. These games are:

  • Barbie Project Friendship (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Lords of the Fallen (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Octopath Traveler (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Octopath Traveler 2 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • SteamWorld Build (Cloud, Console, and PC)

For everything else in Microsoft's subscription service, you can check out our handy Xbox Game Pass guide detailing the many titles available.
